title: Impact of Sleep Deprivation on Stress Levels
content: Sleep deprivation can have a significant impact on stress levels. Chronic undersleeping, which is common among most Americans, leads to hypercortisolemia. This causes a cascade of nonoptimal biological reactions. For example, more cortisol means more anxiety. More anxiety means less sleep, and less sleep means more cortisol and more anxiety, creating an awful feedback loop.

title: Cortisol and Weight Gain
content: Cortisol also plays a role in weight gain. It is a very anabolic hormone to adipose tissue and a very catabolic hormone to muscle tissue. It also affects the liver and glycogen stores via hepatic glucose output. This raises glucose, which in turn raises insulin, which then acts alongside cortisol.

title: Evolutionary Reason for Sleep Deprivation
content: If an animal is sleep deprived, it triggers an evolutionary response that thereâ€™s a reason for the sleep deprivation, therefore more cortisol is needed. This is often referred to as the mental Saber-Tooth Tiger, which is society-triggered anxiety.
